{include "affiliate_loader"} Learn the latest from ACLU of Utah staff and board members. {include "pre-header-spacing"}{beacon}

{include "default_salutation"} –

We are pleased to invite all ACLU of Utah members to our 2020 Virtual Membership Meeting on Tuesday, November 10. Come join us!

This meeting is the perfect opportunity for members to learn about the ACLU of Utah's new and ongoing work and our priorities for the year ahead.

During last year's meeting, we learned how Nikila Venugopal, the ACLU of Utah's first Voting Rights Manager, was preparing for the 2020 election season.

This year, Niki will recap her team's efforts during the recent election – including how we trained and deployed dozens of poll monitors to voting locations in eight counties across Utah.

Plus, you can learn about our Top 20 accomplishments in 2020, watch a special video presentation, and participate in break-out conversation groups with ACLU of Utah staff members.

2020 Virtual Members Meeting

Join us for our annual member meeting to hear directly from ACLU of Utah board members and staff and discover exciting ways to fight for civil rights and freedoms!

Tuesday November 10, 12 – 1 p.m.
Online via Zoom

Register Today

Please note: This link will take you to a third-party website, zoom.us.

Please note this free event is only open to ACLU members!

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Questions: Contact Hannah Nerone at hnerone@acluutah.org.

Thank you for supporting our efforts to protect and advance civil rights and freedoms in Utah. Your involvement is critical to our success!

We hope you will be able to join us.
